location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 1132 from John Pollard Willoughby, Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is instructing the Resident to report on the proceedings of the Chief of Shunas (also spelt Shinas and Sheenas in this item), and to make a certain adjustment in the Military Department.One enclosure; translated substance of a letter from the Native Agent at Muscat to the Persian Secretary dated 8 May 1839.It reports that Saud bin Muttuck, claiming to act on behalf of Khaled al Suood [Amīr Khālid bin Sa'ud], has demanded the assistance of the Governors of Muscat, and the payment of tribute. It further includes details on advances made to two corporals (M McNally and E Stapleton) in order to acquire provisions at Muscat.
